trans-unit.source: Virtual network using configuration tables | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Virtual network using configuration tables | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure a cross-premises Azure virtual network with settings from a configuration table with pre-determined settings.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure a cross-premises Azure virtual network with settings from a configuration table with pre-determined settings.

trans-unit.source: Create a cross-premises virtual network by using configuration tables
trans-unit.target: Create a cross-premises virtual network by using configuration tables

trans-unit.source: This topic steps you through the creation of a cross-premises virtual network by using settings previously specified in the following set of configuration tables:
trans-unit.target: This topic steps you through the creation of a cross-premises virtual network by using settings previously specified in the following set of configuration tables:

trans-unit.source: Table V: Cross-premises virtual network configuration
trans-unit.target: Table V: Cross-premises virtual network configuration

trans-unit.source: Table S: Subnets in the virtual network
trans-unit.target: Table S: Subnets in the virtual network

trans-unit.source: Table D: On-premises DNS servers
trans-unit.target: Table D: On-premises DNS servers

trans-unit.source: Table L: Address prefixes for the local network
trans-unit.target: Table L: Address prefixes for the local network

trans-unit.source: These tables are typically filled out in a topic that describes the configuration of an IT workload in Azure and includes a cross-premises virtual network.
trans-unit.target: These tables are typically filled out in a topic that describes the configuration of an IT workload in Azure and includes a cross-premises virtual network.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Phase 1: Configure Azure</linkText><title></title></link> for an example.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Phase 1: Configure Azure</linkText><title></title></link> for an example.

trans-unit.source: The following procedure references the information in these tables to guide you through the virtual network configuration process.
trans-unit.target: The following procedure references the information in these tables to guide you through the virtual network configuration process.

trans-unit.source: If you have not already specified the settings in these tables in another topic, but you still want to configure a cross-premises virtual network, see <link><linkText>Configure a cross-premises site-to-site connection to an Azure virtual network</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you have not already specified the settings in these tables in another topic, but you still want to configure a cross-premises virtual network, see <link><linkText>Configure a cross-premises site-to-site connection to an Azure virtual network</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: This procedure steps you through creating a virtual network that uses a site-to-site VPN connection.
trans-unit.target: This procedure steps you through creating a virtual network that uses a site-to-site VPN connection.

trans-unit.source: For information about using Azure ExpressRoute for your site-to-site connection, see <link><linkText>ExpressRoute technical overview</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about using Azure ExpressRoute for your site-to-site connection, see <link><linkText>ExpressRoute technical overview</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Create a new cross-premises Azure virtual network by using your configuration table settings
trans-unit.target: Create a new cross-premises Azure virtual network by using your configuration table settings

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: From the taskbar, click New > Network Services > Virtual Network > Custom Create.
trans-unit.target: From the taskbar, click New > Network Services > Virtual Network > Custom Create.

trans-unit.source: On the Virtual Network Details page:
trans-unit.target: On the Virtual Network Details page:

trans-unit.source: In Name, type the name from Item 1 in Table V.
trans-unit.target: In Name, type the name from Item 1 in Table V.

trans-unit.source: In Location, select the region from Item 2 in Table V.
trans-unit.target: In Location, select the region from Item 2 in Table V.

trans-unit.source: Click the next arrow to continue.
trans-unit.target: Click the next arrow to continue.

trans-unit.source: On the DNS Servers and VPN Connectivity page:
trans-unit.target: On the DNS Servers and VPN Connectivity page:

trans-unit.source: In DNS Servers, for each entry in Table D, configure the friendly name and IP address of your on-premises DNS servers.
trans-unit.target: In DNS Servers, for each entry in Table D, configure the friendly name and IP address of your on-premises DNS servers.

trans-unit.source: In Site-To-Site Connectivity, select Configure a site-to-site VPN.
trans-unit.target: In Site-To-Site Connectivity, select Configure a site-to-site VPN.

trans-unit.source: If you have already configured a local network and want to use it, select its name in Local Network.
trans-unit.target: If you have already configured a local network and want to use it, select its name in Local Network.

trans-unit.source: If you want to create a new local network, select Specify a New Local Network in Local Network.
trans-unit.target: If you want to create a new local network, select Specify a New Local Network in Local Network.

trans-unit.source: If you have not already configured a local network for your subscription, you will not see the Local Network field.
trans-unit.target: If you have not already configured a local network for your subscription, you will not see the Local Network field.

trans-unit.source: Click the next arrow to continue.
trans-unit.target: Click the next arrow to continue.

trans-unit.source: On the Site-to-Site Connectivity page (if you selected Specify a New Local Network in step 5):
trans-unit.target: On the Site-to-Site Connectivity page (if you selected Specify a New Local Network in step 5):

trans-unit.source: In Name, type the name from Item 3 in Table V (the local network name).
trans-unit.target: In Name, type the name from Item 3 in Table V (the local network name).

trans-unit.source: In VPN Device IP Address, type the address from Item 4 in Table V.
trans-unit.target: In VPN Device IP Address, type the address from Item 4 in Table V.

trans-unit.source: In Address Space, for each entry in Table L, enter the IP address spaces of your organization network in terms of the prefix (in Starting IP) and the prefix length (in CIDR (Address Count)).
trans-unit.target: In Address Space, for each entry in Table L, enter the IP address spaces of your organization network in terms of the prefix (in Starting IP) and the prefix length (in CIDR (Address Count)).

trans-unit.source: Click the next arrow to continue.
trans-unit.target: Click the next arrow to continue.

trans-unit.source: On the Virtual Network Address Spaces page:
trans-unit.target: On the Virtual Network Address Spaces page:

trans-unit.source: In Address Space, enter the private IP address space of the virtual network from Item 5 in Table V, in terms of the prefix (in Starting IP) and the prefix length (in CIDR (Address Count)).
trans-unit.target: In Address Space, enter the private IP address space of the virtual network from Item 5 in Table V, in terms of the prefix (in Starting IP) and the prefix length (in CIDR (Address Count)).

trans-unit.source: In Subnets, for each entry in Table S:
trans-unit.target: In Subnets, for each entry in Table S:

trans-unit.source: Type the name of the subnet in the Subnets column, overwriting the default name if needed.
trans-unit.target: Type the name of the subnet in the Subnets column, overwriting the default name if needed.

trans-unit.source: Type the private IP address space of the subnet, in terms of the prefix (in Starting IP) and the prefix length (in CIDR (Address Count)).
trans-unit.target: Type the private IP address space of the subnet, in terms of the prefix (in Starting IP) and the prefix length (in CIDR (Address Count)).

trans-unit.source: Click Add Gateway Subnet.
trans-unit.target: Click Add Gateway Subnet.

trans-unit.source: Click the check mark to complete the configuration.
trans-unit.target: Click the check mark to complete the configuration.

trans-unit.source: Additional resources
trans-unit.target: Additional resources

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Virtual network overview</linkText><title></title></link>
